headline: Cranberry Salsa
description: This easy cranberry salsa comes together in minutes in your food processor for a tangy, sweet condiment with a jalapeño kick that's great at any gathering.

video.description: Salsa! An inventive way to use seasonal cranberries.
video.name: Cranberry Salsa

name: Cranberry Salsa
recipeIngredient: 1 bunch green onions, cut into 3 inch lengths
1 medium jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced

recipeInstructions.text: Combine cranberries, sugar, cilantro, green onions, jalapeño, lime juice, and salt in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a medium blade; process to medium consistency.

review.reviewBody: I used only half a cup of sugar.

I love this recipe. After making it a few times, I have a few preferences. First, I don't like cilantro so I substituted parsley. Second, I cut the sugar to 1/2 cup. Third, I found there to be too much liquid so I pressed some of the liquid out using a sieve just before adding it to the cream cheese. I've also made a variation. During the summer, I couldn't find cranberries so I substituted an equal amount of kumqats. It was delightful.

Absolutely wonderful! This salsa is perfect for the holidays - light, tart, and refreshing. My family discovered that it is especially delicious when served with cucumber chips instead of tortilla (although wonderful that way as well) and the red and green were perfect for the Christmas appetizer spread. I will be making this over and over again each year!
My favorite salsa and works as a great garnish, especially around the holidays.
Followed this recipe several times, using fresh cranberries and half the cilantro, with raves reviews! Served with turkey, as well as fish tacos. It's a keeper!!

Loved this recipe! Wish cranberries were available year-round! Only changes I made were that I used about 2 tablespooons of sugar and added a Granny Smith apple. Added a little crunch, and a touch of sweetness. I could see adding a sweeter apple and maybe getting away with even less sugar. Maybe will try that next time. I poured it over cream cheese and served with scalloped red pepper flake crackers. Ended up pulsing it a little too long because I forgot to add the jalapeño. But texture is still good since the cranberries are sturdy. Thanks for sharing the recipe!
Love this recipe, but way too sweet if you make it as is. 1/4-1/3 cup sugar seems to be the sweet spot for us!

This was not very good. I live in the heart of. cranberry country in New Jersey and I’ve made almost every cranberry dish known. Unfortunately, I should have avoided this one. If you love cilantro you’ll love this recipe. The cranberries, jalapeño and most everything else was over powered by the cilantro You may ask why? The directions are the reason. No recipe should be published without some guidelines....what does a “bunch” of cilantro mean? Apparently, much less than I added. How about 1/4 cup chopped and verbiage “add more to taste”. Just a suggestion. I should have known to steer clear of recipes with vague quantities. My fault

Wow! Had cranberries left over from making Christmas potpourri AND was asked to bring an appetizer to a dinner party. When this recipe popped up, I thought I’d give it a try. I didn’t tough chop onion or jalapeño as directed which made it a little difficult to blend at first. I used 1/4 c Splenda and 1/8-1/4 c sugar, and 2 T lime juice. I see what others are saying. First bite you aren’t sure, but once you get used to the flavor combo/tartness, it’s soooo good! I’m going to serve with wheat thins, but I had some crustini ? bread bites I used to test it and it was great as well. Would be nice to have that and wheat thins as options. Also, it made so much I couldn’t neatly fit it all in my serving dish, so I experimented with fat free cream cheese in my extras dish. It was great. I don’t think I would have known, but some cream cheese connoisseur may say otherwise. If you are a calorie counter, this way, Splenda/part sugar is at most 77 calories per serving not counting cream cheese/crackers.
A very different spin on cranberry dressing for Thanksgiving turkey. Worked even better after on tortilla chips.

I have made this several times in the past 2 years. I only made a couple of adjustments. I found it needed a lot more salt but the sugar has to be added in small amounts and tasted. The sugar will depend on how tart the cranberries are. I also zest my limes before juicing and add zest. I served it with and without the cream cheese twice and almost everyone chose without as their favorite. I serve Tostitos scoops with it. I found out you can freeze cranberries easily either in their original bag or as I did by placing the bags into freezer bags. They remain fresh like this for 8-12 months.
Amazing. So good.
I made it with Monkfruit sweetener
Unique, healthy and really good. The combination of sweet and onion was wonderful.
By itself seemed spicy, but with the cream cheese it could use more.
I took out the green onion and salt and serve it at my family Thanksgiving and it was a hit
Such a great recipe! Nice alternative to “regular” salsa. Always a hit at parties.

Tasty, easy to make and very popular! If you have people who don't like cilantro, try using diced red onion to expand the flavor profile. Highly recommend refrigerating overnight, if possible, to let the flavors fully blend.
Outstanding! I am addicted. So fresh and unique tasting. Easy to make.

I added garlic salt and a splash of apple cider vinegar. 
I made this for a baby shower and Christmas party. It’s a HIT!! Even better after a few days.
I used Splenda instead of sugar and it was great. Served it over cream cheese. Very tasty
Very easy and tasty. I would add more jalapeno next time. I used 1, as the recipe says, but I couldn't really taste it. Yummy over cream cheese with crackers.

I love this recipe! A friend made it for a get together a few years ago and I’ve been making it every since for the holidays. I do decrease the sugar to only 1/2 cup and I don’t seed the jalapeño, we like it spicy!
I made this recipe as it was written. I think less sugar and more jalapeno would make it better.

This is a winner. It is essential for this recipe that you make it the day before using it, so the flavors can develop. I cut the sugar down to 1/2 cup. I also used the whole jalapeno, which is probably too hot for most people. I had this recipe in the past and lost it. I am so happy to have found it again as it is soooo good!

Really good, really easy. Decreased sugar to 1/2 cup as preference. Add more or less sugar to your own taste. Used a 1/3 bunch of cilantro as I am not a big cilantro fan. Used fresh cranberries, served over a cream cheese block with holes poked in it for Thanksgiving appetizer.
Addictive

Made it using half the amount of sugar and half the amount of cilantro, and it was a BIG hit at our Thanksgiving dinner!! Folks were enthused about its freshness and "zip," without being overly sweet, and all thought it would take the next day's turkey sandwiches to a whole new level! A nice fresh alternative to our usual (cooked) sweet and tangy citrus, pecan and cranberry sauce.

I made this as a Thanksgiving appetizer. I followed other users advice and made it in advance, set it on some cream cheese, and let it sit in the fridge for the day. The funny thing about this dish is that it shouldn't be a fall/Thanksgiving dish!

The fact that it IS a salsa really comes through and frankly I'd rather have this on a taco than on a cracker, baguette slice, or turkey meat any day! I'm glad to have the leftovers for my family's weekly taco night! Yum!

This recipe was so good and I normally don't like cranberries! The only substitutes I did was use 2 Tbsp of Monkfruit sweetener instead of sugar and used 2 jalapenos. I kept the seeds in and it was HOT and sweet! It had no aftertaste from the Monkfuit and I didn't feel guilty eating it! YUMMY!!

What a simple and quick recipe. The salsa is great!! Since we like it more spicy, I added another jalapeño with some seeds. Also, I put extra lime juice. I think it would be just as good with just a little less sugar. Great recipe!
I was short a lime so I used a lemon.
Great with cream cheese block and crackers. It was a very big hit with my guests.
Cut the sugar, but so delicious!
I would probably add another jalapeno for a bit more bite to balance the sweetness.
Excellent and easy to prepare. Definitely a crowd pleaser
Colorful and festive! Fresh (even using cranberries that I placed in the freezer) and tasty, too! I used about 1/3 of the sugar and more salt than called for in! This is a keeper!
Way too sweet! I only put a half cup of sugar and wish I used even less.
Loved it! No cilantro for me and jarred jalapenos were great but added more to taste. Rave reviews at the parties!

I made this for a pre Christmas family dinner but it just might become my standard for salsa. This salsa is sweet- tart- spicy- and very good tasting. I’m not a fan of cream cheese but it definitely made the dish better in this instance. MORE PLEASE was the only request made about this salsa.
Yummy, big hit! This will be a standard in our Thanksgiving menu.
This is always a hit. I served it with chips, but I intend to put it over cream cheese next time I serve it.
Loved it, so did my family! Will be making this a lot!!
Love it!
Leave out the green onions and reduce the sugar. My family loves it!!!
Outstanding! One of the best, unique salsas I have ever tasted.
Delicious! Since my husband detests cilantro, I subbed this with flat-leaf parsley. I also reduced the sugar to less than 1/2 a cup, and only used 1 lime. Will be making this again!

This a family favorite for both Thanksgiving and Christmas. The only changes are adding a small can of crushed pineapple, and reduce the sugar a bit. I spread cream cheese over a large serving plate and spread the cranberry salsa over the top. So yummy served with crackers!
Delicious and addicting
Salsa was a huge hit. I halved the sugar and used 1 lime. Next time I’ll add 2 jalapeños. Great fresh flavor and perfect for the holidays.

First time making this recipe, it was delicious! I put it over a block of softened cream cheese with crackers. Everyone loved the blend of flavors! For us it was just spicy enough but you could add more jalapeños to make it spicy. The key is making it the day before. Definitely making this again!!!
Loved this. For me, I would cut back on the jalapeño a bit because ours from the garden was spicy. Really great over cream cheese. I may try reducing the sugar slightly in the future as well.
All the members of my family just loves this! Even the ones that don't usually like cranberries thought that this was really good. And we put it on everything.

I was excited to bring this to our annual camping trip. There were about 21 of us, all adults, so I thought it'd be a fun & different type of snack. Most of the people are open to trying new things. This recipe bombed, no one liked it for more than one mouthful. It was over powered with cilantro taste, which surprised me since I used what it called for. Not sure what it needs to be better, but I guess I won't waste my time trying to figure it out. I'd say if you don't like cilantro, don't add as much as called for. No other ideas of how to make better. Maybe add a can of crushed pineapple?
I came across this recipe a few days ago, needless to say I’ve been dying to make it. I made it tonight and WOW! I didn’t deviate from the recipe at all... NONE! This is soooo good!!!!

This recipe is a total find! Here are my changes: I processed each ingredient separately to control consistency of each ingredient. Per reviews I only used 1/3 cup of sugar, used 2 pickled jalapeños (seeded) and a little of the jalapeño juice. My son said "it is amazing" ~ Thanks for posting!

Modifications needed, but highly recommend this...

We have made this recipe for last 10+ years. I found it in the comments of a lifestyle blog. Here is the revised recipe: 1 pkg whole fresh cranberry, 1 small bunch cilantro (you can use thin stems), 1 small bunch green onion (whites & greens minced), 1 lime zest & juice, 1 or 2 jalapeno (seeded), 2 tablespoon minced ginger, 1/3 to 1/2 cup sugar and 1/2 teaspoon salt. We use food processor only for the cranberry and mince everything else by hand.

Other tips: Ginger is the magic ingredient. Sugar - start with 1/3 cup sugar; 3/4 cup sugar will make this too sweet! ( I use 1/2 cup sugar in a double batch). It's better on tortilla chips than with cream cheese. Make it at least 4 hours prior, but preferably night before.

I'm a cranberry lover and this recipe sparked my interest. Although I like it hot my wife does not so I skipped the jalapenos. Made a day ahead of time and and let it sit overnight in the fridge. I served this on a turkey tacos and it was outstanding! Also goes well on chips or crackers and I think would be wonderful mixed with Greek yogurt. I'll definitely be making this again!
I used 2 jalapeno peppers and was glad I did that. I did make it 1 day ahead but I'd actually recommend 2 days to really allow the flavors to mix together.
This was an excellent topper for the Turkey. something different an tasty.

This recipe was incredible!!! Watch the size of the jalepeno, 1.5” length should be perfect, so it’s not too hot.
The salsa would be fantastic over grilled pork loin chops.
Cranberry season is short, so stock up, and freeze cranberries for future use!

I got a ton of complements on this salsa. And, since I don't have a food processor, I had to use my little Cuisinart chopper, which worked well when I chopped the cranberries separately and then mixed everything together. 

It was really delicious!

I made this for my crochet group last night! As suggested, I served it over cream cheese. The only change I made to the recipe was a little less sugar. It was devoured! They all begged for the recipe. This one is a no-brainer! I will be making it again soon!
This is a keeper. I cut the sugar in half as suggested by others. Followed the directions exactly aside from that. Fantastic - everyone loves it.

This was a great salsa. What a wonderful combo of ingredients. It was so easy too. I would definitely make it a day ahead for the full flavor. Will make a wonderful addition to any chicken or turkey meal . One jalapeno pepper was just right for me.

I had so many cranberries left over from thanksgiving, and this was the perfect solution. The first batch went over so well, I had enough cranberries to make a second! I really recommend letting the salsa sit overnight, it will be so much spicier! Very tangy spicy salsa.
This recipe is easy and very tasty. It also loooks I wish it had a bit less sugar so I may substitute some stevia next time around.
This recipe was too sweet and still very tangy. Too tangy for me to eat more than a few small bites. No one in my house was a fan of this. We won't be making it again.
We look forward to making and enjoying this recipe every Christmas! Young and "old" alike, LOVE IT!!
Great recipe! My only change was to substitute 10 packs of Splenda for the sugar.
has a good kick to it and the cranberries make it very festive

I have never had as many requests for a recipe as this one! I made it exactly as is and it was a hit! I might even add an extra jalapeño next time but it was great regardless. I made it with fresh cranberries for a Thanksgiving appetizer so I prepared everything on Tuesday and let it all sit and meld, Wednesday poked holes in a block of cream cheese and poured it over, and served it on Thursday with multigrain crackers. it was a serious favorite.
I used my leftover thanksgiving cranberry sauce(about 1 cup) so I didn't add any sugar. I also added an extra jalapeño, and a tad more lime juice. This was perfect over shredded turkey!
Absolutely refreshing and delicious! Quick and easily make. Tases even better one left overnight.
Yum
This is one of my Thanksgiving favorites. I serve it as an appetizer on Thanksgiving day and then on a Hawaiian roll with turkey for left overs on the day after. Yum!
amazing!!

Good flavor... even one jalapeno made it quite spicy! I followed the recipe and made several batches. I ran out of sugar and used Truvia baking sugar instead of real sugar and it was not noticeable. Can't wait to pour this over cream cheese and scoop it up!
Thanks for the unique recipe.

I thought this was excellent! The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 was because it only called for one jalapeno. I couldn't even taste it. The second time I made it, because the first batch got gone so quickly, I put two in. Still couldn't taste it. Next time I'll go for three. I'm wondering what it would taste like with habineros in it. I'll bet it'd be awesome! Great recipe. Thanks for sharing!
Delicious and easy appetizer to make. This can be made a day ahead also. Thanks Shash
I really liked the recipe, and will make it again, but will reduce the amount of sugar. Was a crowd pleaser at a recent dinner party.
BIG BIG hit! Haven't heard of anyone that doesn't love this; and it's festive for Christmas time too. I've served it with blue and regular tortilla chips.

This raw cranberry salsa was a HUGE hit at our holiday feast - we always smoke a turkey, and season up a standing rib for roasting in the oven. This cranberry salsa stood up wonderfully to the strong smokey/seasoned flavorings of the meats. It is just spicy enough, and has just the right amount of sweet. It lasts well (a week in the 'fridge), and is extremely easy to prepare!
Amazing seasonal appetizer! Made this for Thanksgiving and it was requested again for Christmas. omitted the cilantro since I don't like it.
Amazing seasonal appetizer! Made this for Thanksgiving and it was requested again for Christmas. omitted the cilantro since I don't like it.
I love this! I make it at Christmas every year! I like a little more heat, so add a habanero to it, too!
I love this salsa and my guests did too.
I followed Heidi's recommendation using 1/2 cup sugar, 1 lime and 2 jalapenos...my family loved it and everyone asked for the recipe and/or made me promise I would make it again at Christmas

Wow! Thank you...this recipe was a HIT at my party. I literally had to promise everyone I would send them the recipe. I did follow the suggestions and cut the sugar to 1/2cup and poured the salsa over cream cheese and served with multigrain chips. I only had an hour for the salsa to chill in the refrigerator vs. over night and it was still incredible!
this is a really easy recipe. Everyone really enjoyed it.

I made this today to see if I wanted to make a large batch for our day after Christmas party, and I was very Surprised how good it was. I did cut the sugar to just a little over 1/4 cup. And added 1 Habanero chili pepper instead of Jalepeno.
My husband who is very picky loved it. Great over cream cheese!

Very versatile how it is, great over chicken or turkey but as a salsa holy cow it's sweet and no spice! I recommend putting in 1.5 limes, juiced of course and a little lime zest. Add an extra jalapeño and CUT THE SUGAR to about 1/3 cup than add more as you go to your desired taste.
We made this for Thanksgiving this year and it was a big hit! We served it over creme cheese and it was gone pretty fast!
will definitely make it again.... I added an extra jalapeno and did not seed the peppers...
This is a ball out of park. I get nothing but raves for this delicious and unique variation on cranberries.

Made this as the recipe calls and it was wonderful. I did not have a full bunch of cilantro, but enough to give it a great flavor. Think I might use two jalapenos the next time. My daughter almost cried when I told her she could take the remainder home with her!! Like most others, I put it over a block of cream cheese. Has already been requested for xmas.
We use NM green chile instead of the jalapeno
Fresh, tangy and delicious.

First off, I will definitely make this again. However I will tweak it next time. I think half the cilantro might help (I'm not a big fan of cilantro though) and adding some orange zest or juice might help. There was something a little off about this. It was good but I think it can be improved. Maybe a bit of agave nectar for sweetness?
